q: Michael Beschloss gave Donald Rumsfeld an opportunity at the end to explain what he'd tell a family that lost a loved one in Iraq. He answered that when he and his wife met with wounded soldiers at military hospitals: We came out of those meetings feeling inspired- not that we had helped them, but they had helped us. Indeed, Donald Rumsfeld conceded that it's hard today to give a simple explanation- as you could with World War II- what the Iraq war and related terrorism conflicts were all about. "

has revealed that he has been kicked off Facebook because he was thought to be an imposter. The X Factor host did have an account on the social networking site, but it was taken off. I've got to be honest, they chucked me off Facebook- they thought it was someone pretending to be me, so I haven't got a Facebook, they literally threw me off Facebook, how annoying is that? he told Absolute Radio's Christian O'Connell on his breakfast show. will be the Mountain View Internet juggernaut's new CEO starting April 4, and current CEO Eric Schmidt will be executive chairman, Eric Schmidt revealed in a post today on Google's blog. Co-founder Sergey Brin , meanwhile, has decided to devote his time and energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products. His title will be co-founder. He's an innovator and entrepreneur to the core, and this role suits him perfectly, Eric Schmidt said. "As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated," Eric Schmidt wrote.
